Information Escrows to Combat Code Fraud

Updated November 05, 2015

This exerpt is taken from a November 5th post by Laura Norén on the Berkeley Institute for Data Science blog.

Code fraud is the implementation of software that induces illegal, unethical, or otherwise malicious outcomes. Laura Norén, postdoctoral Associate at NYU’s Center for Data Science, writes about code fraud, code review, risks around whistleblowing, and lowering the barrier for reporting code fraud. No need for potential whistleblowers to act like scared woodland creatures!

Read the original blog post
